title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When selecting a file in the project Navigator and choosing 'Open With...' followed by 'Default Text Editor' while the file is already open in another editor, nothing happens. The file remains open in the original editor and no new editor is opened.
EB: When selecting a file in the project Navigator and choosing 'Open With...' followed by 'Default Text Editor' while the file is already open in another editor, a new editor should open for the file. The new editor should reflect the content of the file and its type, even if it is different from the original editor.
SR:
1. Create a new basic project.
2. Create a new file named 'test.xml'.
3. Open the 'test.xml' file in the scripted resource editor example.
4. In the project Navigator, select the 'test.xml' file.
5. Right-click on the selected file and choose 'Open With...' from the context menu.
6. From the 'Open With...' menu, select 'Default Text Editor'.
7. Verify that a new editor opens for the 'test.xml' file, different from the scripted resource editor example.
8. Ensure that the new editor displays the content of the 'test.xml' file appropriately, considering its XML file type.
